head_unstable.issue: Head position unstable - excessive pitch variation

drills.name: Neutral Head Drill
drills.focus: Keep head neutral, eyes looking 45Â° down
steps: Push off wall with perfect streamline
Focus on single spot on pool floor
Keep head still - move from shoulders down

drills.name: Extended Neutral Position Hold
drills.focus: Maintain neutral head throughout full length
steps: Use tempo trainer set to desired stroke rate
Focus on head stability during arm recovery
Keep chin tucked slightly (fist distance from chest)
Film yourself to verify neutral position

curvature_high.issue: Excessive body curvature (banana shape) during glide

drills.name: Streamline Hold with Wall Push
drills.focus: Maintain straight body line from fingertips to toes

drills.name: Streamline + Kick Combo
steps: Add one slow, controlled breaststroke kick
Focus on keeping hips high during recovery
Repeat cycle to end of pool

drills.name: Single Kick Stabilization
steps: Push off wall centered on lane line
Execute one kick, watching lane line below
Goal: stay perfectly centered on line

drills.name: Core Stability Training
drills.focus: Build core strength to reduce wobble
steps: Focus on rotation from core, not shoulders
Keep hips stable - no snaking motion

kick_recovery_slow.issue: Kick recovery too slow - legs not returning to streamline quickly

drills.name: Explosive Recovery Drill
drills.focus: Snap legs together quickly after power phase
steps: Focus on speed of recovery, not power

drills.name: Breaststroke Kick on Back
steps: Float on back, arms in streamline above head
Watch knees - they should not break water surface

kick_asymmetry.issue: Leg asymmetry - left and right legs not moving together

drills.name: Mirror Symmetry Check
steps: Swim facing pool bottom (side view if possible)
Watch both legs in peripheral vision
Ensure both knees bend at same time

drills.name: Resistance Band Training
steps: Attach resistance band around ankles (on deck)
Focus on equal resistance on both legs

kick_width_suboptimal.issue: Kick width not in optimal range for propulsion

drills.name: Width Calibration Drill
steps: First rep: very narrow kick (shoulder width)
Second rep: medium kick (1.5x shoulder width)
Third rep: wide kick (2x shoulder width)

drills.name: Target Width Training
steps: Set mental target width (use visual cue like lane width)
Execute all kicks at this exact width
Goal: same kick count each rep

arm_sweep_high.issue: Excessive lateral arm sweep - creates braking force

drills.name: Straight Pull Drill
drills.focus: Pull straight back, not out to sides
steps: Pull hands straight back under body
Hands should not go wider than shoulders
Focus on backward motion, not outward

drills.name: Single Arm Stroke
steps: Feel water resistance - pull through it, not around it

glide_ratio_low.issue: Insufficient glide phase - working too hard

drills.name: Stroke Counting
steps: Next rep: try to reduce count by 1
Extend glide by 1 second each time

drills.name: Extended Glide Training
drills.focus: Build comfort with longer glide phases
steps: After each stroke, count to 3 before next stroke
Focus on maintaining streamline during glide
Only stroke when speed drops significantly

drills.name: Tempo Trainer Drill
steps: Use tempo trainer set to desired BPM
